Package com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest

The smartrest package holds classes to access the SmartREST interface of the cloud of things server.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    SmartListener
    A SmartListener receives real time notifications for messageIds, to which it was registered in the SmartCepConnector.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    SmartCepConnector
    The SmartCepConnector handles subscriptions and holds the connection to the CEP notification service.
    SmartNotification
    A SmartNotification contains one line of the response data that was received from the server and the X-Id The data will be a CSV-String, not including the messageId.
    SmartRequest
    Represents a request to send via SmartREST API.
    SmartRequestTemplate
    A SmartRequestTemplate is used server side to transform a SmartREST request into a regular REST request.
    SmartResponse
    Represents a response received via SmartREST API.
    SmartResponseTemplate
    A SmartResponseTemplate is used server side to transform a REST response into one line of a SmartREST response.
    SmartRestApi
    The SmartRestApi is used to register and query SmartREST-templates and to execute requests against them.
    SmartTemplate
    Base class for SmartRequestTemplate and SmartResponseTemplate, both of which have an id and need the same kind of escaping for some of their parameters.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    SmartRequest.ProcessingMode  

Package com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest Description

The smartrest package holds classes to access the SmartREST interface of the cloud of things server.

The starting point here is the SmartRestApi, which you can get from the CloudOfThingsPlatform.

To do SmartREST requests you need to store one or more SmartRequestTemplates and to get a SmartREST response you need to store one or more SmartResponseTemplate.
Then you can execute SmartREST requests and the server will use your SmartRequestTemplates to turn them into regular REST requests. The JSON response of these requests will be evaluated by the SmartResponseTemplates, each of which can generate one line of output, containing data that it extracted from the JSON.
All the SmartResponseTemplates are used at the same time, and each matching one will produce another response line.

Each type or version of a device (or, more general, client) has an X-Id. X-Ids are local to a tenant. This ID is used to match devices to their templates. Devices can also use/support more than one X-Id.

Each device should be able to store it's templates, after querying the server for their existence.
Templates cannot be updated. It is only possible to delete and recreate them all.

Each SmartTemplate has a client defined messageId, which is local to the X-Id. MessageIds should start from 100, in order to not clash with server defined messages.

For usage examples see SmartRestApiIT.

For real time notifications (CEP) see SmartCepConnector.

More explanations about the concepts can be found at http://cumulocity.com/guides/reference/smartrest/
